name: crochet pumpkin with leaf coasters
sizes_available: pumpkin sits approx 3.5 inches tall and 5.5 inches wide. coaster measures approx 4.25 inches across.
notes:

add this pattern to your cart to unlock the exclusive discounted price—don't miss this sale!**

❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️

create your own adorable fall pumpkin that is a nifty coaster holder! the charming curly stems can be easily pulled out from the center, transforming into leaf-shaped coasters. it’s a quick and fun project, perfect for sprucing up your fall home decor or gifting to loved ones.

this is a quick and affordable project with only two balls of yarn. for the pumpkin, we will be using a method that creates a bulkier weight yarn by holding three strands together, but this can be worked from one ball! check out the tutorial: [https://brianakdesigns.com/bulky-yarn-1-skein/][1]

if you would like, a bulky weight yarn can be substituted instead of using three strands at once.

crochet pumpkin with leaf coasters has a stitch video tutorial: [https://youtu.be/khsyxwsg5c8][2]

**crochet hook:**
[recommended hook size h (5.0mm)][3] - or size to meet gauge

**notations:**
[removable stitch marker][4]
[yarn needle to weave in ends][5] 
[scissors][6]

**yarn:**
[mary maxim starlette worsted][7]
100% ultra soft acrylic, 180yds/100g

**yardage:**
colorways shown:
pumpkin: cottonwood natural, medium
taupe and warm brown.
125 yds (1 skein per pumpkin)
leaves: mid green
12o yds per 4 leaves (1 skein)

**abbreviations**
ch - chain
dc - double crochet
rnd- round
sc - single crochet
sl st - slip stitch
st(s) - stitch(es)
stsc - stacked single crochet

**gauge:**
16 sts x 8 rows = 4x4” in double crochet
not critical for this project.

not sure what gauge is? check out this blog post: [what is crochet gauge and how to fix it][8]

**measurements:**
pumpkin sits approx 3.5 inches tall and 5.5 inches wide.
coaster measures approx 4.25 inches across.

**skill level:**
advanced beginner
